empty.connectTitle: Connect tldw Assistant to your server
empty.connectDescription: Some settings only take effect when your tldw server is reachable. Connect your server to get the full experience.
empty.connectExample1: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL and API key.
empty.connectExample2: Use Diagnostics to confirm your server is healthy before trying advanced tools.
empty.title: Tune how tldw Assistant behaves
empty.description: Adjust defaults for the Web UI, sidepanel, speech, search, and data handling from one place.
empty.example1: Choose your default language, theme, and chat resume behavior.
empty.example2: Control whether chats are temporary, how large pastes are handled, and how reasoning is displayed.

managePrompts.emptyExample1: Save your favorite system prompt for summaries, explanations, or translations.
managePrompts.emptyExample2: Create quick prompts for common actions like drafting emails or refining notes.
managePrompts.filterHelp: Search matches title and prompt content. Use type and tags to narrow the list.

managePrompts.copilotEmptyExample2: After updating your server, reload the extension and return to this tab.

about.support: tldw Assistantプロジェクトは、以下のプラットフォームで寄付やスポンサーシップをすることで支援できます:

onboarding.title: Welcome — Let’s get you connected
onboarding.description: Configure your server and authentication. We’ll verify the connection and RAG health inline.
onboarding.learnMoreTldw: tldw サーバーの仕組みを学ぶ

serverUrl.invalid: http://127.0.0.1:8000 のような完全な URL を入力してください。
serverUrl.invalidProtocol: http または https の URL を使用してください（例: http://127.0.0.1:8000）。
serverUrl.label: Server URL
serverUrl.emptyHint: Enter your tldw server URL to enable Next.
serverUrl.ready: We’ll enable Next once we can reach this address.
serverUrl.reachable: Server responded successfully. You can continue.
serverUrl.unreachable: We couldn’t reach this address yet. Double-check the URL or try again.

apiKey.label: API Key
apiKey.placeholder: Enter your API key (or use the default demo key THIS-IS-A-SECURE-KEY-123-REPLACE-ME for local single-user setups)

connection.label: Connection:
connection.continueAnyway: You can continue and complete setup now. You’ll be able to verify the connection later from Settings.

onboarding.footerHelp: Once connected, you can revisit these settings anytime from the extension menu.

manageCharacters.title: Manage Characters

tags.label: Tags
tags.help: Use tags to group characters by use case (e.g., “writing”, “teaching”).

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this character? This action cannot be undone.

form.description: Define a reusable character you can chat with in the sidebar.

systemPrompt.label: Behavior / instructions
systemPrompt.placeholder: E.g., You are a patient math teacher who explains concepts step by step and checks understanding with short examples.
systemPrompt.help: Explain the character's role, tone, and constraints. For example: "You are a patient math tutor who explains concepts step by step."
systemPrompt.min: Add a short description so the character knows how to respond.

greeting.label: Greeting message (optional)
greeting.placeholder: Hi there! I’m your writing coach. Paste your draft and I’ll help you tighten it up.
greeting.help: Optional first message the character will send when you start a chat.

notification.someError: Something went wrong. Please try again later

loadError.title: Couldn't load characters
loadError.description: Check your connection and try again.

manageCharacters.emptyDescription: Create a reusable character with a name, description, and system prompt you can chat with.
manageCharacters.emptyExample1: Define a writing coach, lore expert, or coding assistant you can reuse across chats.
manageCharacters.emptyExample2: Give each character a clear description and behavior so their responses stay consistent.

systemNotifications.importSuccess: データを正常にインポートしました
systemNotifications.syncSuccess: Firefox のデータを同期しました。再実行は不要です

promptStudio.title: Prompt Studio
promptStudio.subtitle: Configure defaults and monitor Prompt Studio health. Connection and auth reuse the main server settings.
promptStudio.defaultsHint: Store default project, model configs, and list page size.
promptStudio.defaultsPlaceholder: Persist defaults using existing settings storage (TBD) for initial project selection, execute/evaluation model presets, and pagination.
promptStudio.unavailable: Prompt Studio isn’t available on the server yet.
promptStudio.unavailableBody: Once enabled, you can monitor queue health and set defaults here.

charactersSettingsDescription: Characters are managed from the Characters workspace. Use the button below to open it.

healthSummary.diagnosticsTooltip: Open detailed diagnostics to troubleshoot or inspect health checks.
healthSummary.footerInfo: These checks summarize the last successful ping to your tldw server and knowledge index.

storage.quotaFriendlyMessage: Too many settings writes in a short period; please wait a few seconds and try again.
storage.writeErrorDescription: We couldn't save your settings. Please try again shortly.

evaluations.title: Evaluations playground
evaluations.subtitle: Define evaluations against your tldw server and inspect recent runs.
evaluations.loadErrorDescription: Check your tldw server connection and API credentials, then try again.
evaluations.emptyList: No evaluations yet. Once you create one, it will appear here.
evaluations.rateLimitsErrorDescription: We could not retrieve evaluation quotas from the server.
evaluations.rateLimitsNoData: Rate limit information is not available for this server.
evaluations.noEvalSelectedRuns: Select an evaluation to see its recent runs.
evaluations.runsEmpty: No runs yet for this evaluation.
evaluations.noRunSelected: Select a run to see details.
evaluations.datasetsEmpty: No datasets yet. Create one to attach to evaluations.
evaluations.datasetCreateSuccessDescription: Your dataset is ready to use in evaluations.
evaluations.datasetCreateErrorDescription: The server rejected this dataset. Check the fields and try again.
evaluations.evalNameValidation: Use only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores.
evaluations.evalSpecParseError: Evaluation spec must be valid JSON.
evaluations.inlineDatasetCheckbox: Attach inline dataset instead of referencing dataset_id
evaluations.createErrorDescription: The server rejected this evaluation. Ensure name, type, and spec are valid.
evaluations.deleteConfirmDescription: This will remove the evaluation definition. Runs already created remain in history.
evaluations.noEvalSelectedDetails: Select an evaluation to inspect its spec.
evaluations.runCreateSuccessDescription: Your evaluation run has started. You can monitor it from the server UI.
evaluations.runCreateErrorDescription: The server rejected this run request. Check the model and try again.
evaluations.historyEmpty: Run a query to see recent activity.
evaluations.emptyConnectDescription: To create and run evaluations, first connect to your tldw server.
evaluations.emptyConnectExample1: Open Settings → tldw server to add your server URL and API key.
evaluations.emptyConnectExample2: Once connected, you can define evaluations and inspect metrics here.
evaluations.datasetSamplesEmpty: No samples returned for this page.

evaluationsSettings.title: Evaluations
evaluationsSettings.subtitle: Configure defaults used by the Evaluations playground.
evaluationsSettings.offline: Connect to your tldw server to test Evaluations.
